description: Evaluates prospective adopter's lifestyle factors including activity level, work schedule, living space, experience with pets, family composition, and commitment capacity

lifestyle_assessment.activity_level: Moderately active with good exercise capacity. Score: 7/10. Suitable for pets requiring regular but not excessive physical activity.
lifestyle_assessment.time_availability: 2-3 hours daily dedicated to pet care with remote work 4 days/week providing excellent flexibility and presence. Work schedule allows for midday check-ins and companionship.
lifestyle_assessment.stability: High stability with established remote work routine and minimal travel (2-3 times yearly). Predictable schedule creates consistent environment for pet.

environment_assessment.space_adequacy: 1200 sq ft apartment provides adequate space for small to medium-sized pets. Layout suitable for indoor pet activities and comfortable living arrangements.
environment_assessment.outdoor_access: Small balcony available for limited outdoor exposure. Will require regular walks to nearby parks or outdoor areas for exercise and enrichment.
environment_assessment.housing_restrictions: Apartment living may have breed, size, or species restrictions. Verification of pet policies and potential deposit requirements needed.

experience_level.previous_pets: Previous dog ownership 5 years ago demonstrates foundational understanding of pet care responsibilities and daily routines.
experience_level.knowledge_score: 6/10 - Intermediate level with practical experience but may need refresher on current best practices and training methods.
experience_level.training_capability: Moderate capability for basic obedience and behavioral management. May benefit from professional support for complex behavioral issues or specialized training needs.

commitment_factors.time_commitment: Strong daily availability with 2-3 hours dedicated time plus remote work presence 80% of week. Schedule supports consistent feeding, exercise, and companionship routines.
commitment_factors.financial_readiness: Remote work stability suggests steady income. Should confirm budget for routine care ($100-200/monthly), emergency veterinary costs ($1000-5000), and pet insurance considerations.
commitment_factors.long_term_stability: Good indicators for long-term commitment with stable work arrangement and established lifestyle. Infrequent travel pattern manageable with planning. Single household provides consistent primary caregiver.

ideal_pet_characteristics.energy_level: Moderate energy level pet best suited. Can accommodate daily walks and play sessions but not high-intensity working breeds requiring 3+ hours of vigorous activity.
ideal_pet_characteristics.size_preference: Small to medium-sized pets (under 40-50 lbs) most appropriate for apartment living and balcony space constraints.
ideal_pet_characteristics.care_complexity: Low to moderate maintenance pets recommended. Can handle regular grooming, training, and healthcare needs but may find high-needs or specialized medical care challenging as single caregiver.
